hexagrams.name: Qián
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Pure creative force, initiative, clarity, and leadership.
hexagrams.judgement: Great potential and success arise from strong character, persistence, and staying true to your core principles.
hexagrams.imageText: The sky moves with steady, powerful motion. The wise mirror this by constantly improving themselves.

lines.text: Hidden dragon. Your strength is not yet visible. Stay low, prepare quietly, and avoid forcing things.
lines.original: 初九：潜龙勿用。

lines.text: The dragon appears in the field. Your talent begins to be seen. It is a good time to step forward modestly.
lines.original: 九二：见龙在田，利见大人。

lines.text: The noble dragon works tirelessly. Constant vigilance brings no blame, but know when to rest.
lines.original: 九三：君子终日乾乾，夕惕若，厉，无咎。

lines.text: The dragon hesitates at the abyss. Either leap or stay; there is no fault in choosing wisely.
lines.original: 九四：或跃在渊，无咎。

lines.text: The flying dragon is in the sky. This is the time of full power and clear recognition.
lines.original: 九五：飞龙在天，利见大人。

lines.text: The arrogant dragon goes too far and falls. When success is extreme, humility is vital.
lines.original: 上九：亢龙有悔。

hexagrams.name: Kūn
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Receptive earth, support, nurturing, and following the right guidance.
hexagrams.judgement: Great receptivity and benefit come from openness, devotion, and following what is correct.
hexagrams.imageText: The earth carries and nourishes all things. The wise act with generosity, patience, and devoted service.

lines.text: Frost on the ground hints that winter is near. Small signs show larger changes are coming.
lines.original: 初六：履霜，坚冰至。

lines.text: Straight, square, and great. Accept your role and act with honesty and stability.
lines.original: 六二：直方大，不习无不利。

lines.text: Hidden beauty can be preserved. If serving others, do not seek credit; completion matters more.
lines.original: 六三：含章可贞，或从王事，无成有终。

lines.text: A tied-up sack. Sometimes it is wiser to stay closed and quiet than to push outward.
lines.original: 六四：括囊，无咎无誉。

lines.text: A yellow lower garment. Simple, balanced, and proper behavior brings good fortune.
lines.original: 六五：黄裳元吉。

lines.text: Dragons fight in the wild. Too much yielding or too much force both cause loss.
lines.original: 上六：龙战于野，其血玄黄。

hexagrams.name: Zhūn
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Difficulty at the beginning, chaos turning into growth through patience.
hexagrams.judgement: Beginnings are full of struggle and confusion, yet they also hold the seed of growth. Move carefully and seek support.
hexagrams.imageText: Thunder stirs beneath the rain. The wise establish order in times of confusion and support others patiently.

lines.text: Hesitation and blocked movement. Do not rush ahead alone; take small, careful steps.
lines.original: 初九：磐桓，利居贞，利建侯。

lines.text: Difficulties pile up like a loaded carriage. Offers of help will come; accept them wisely.
lines.original: 六二：屯如邅如，乘马班如。匪寇，婚媾。

lines.text: Chasing the deer without a guide leads you into the forest. Better to wait than to waste effort.
lines.original: 六三：即鹿无虞，惟入于林中，君子几不如舍。

lines.text: Seeking help brings progress. Moving forward now is favorable.
lines.original: 六四：乘马班如，求婚媾，往吉，无不利。

lines.text: Small matters proceed well; great ventures face difficulty. Be patient and sincere.
lines.original: 九五：屯其膏，小贞吉，大贞凶。

lines.text: Lost and weeping blood. The struggle reaches its peak; turn back and regroup.
lines.original: 上六：乘马班如，泣血涟如。

hexagrams.name: Mēng
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Youthful folly and inexperience requiring education and guidance.
hexagrams.judgement: Success comes not from the teacher seeking the student, but from the student seeking the teacher with sincerity.
hexagrams.imageText: A spring flows at the foot of the mountain. The wise nourishes character through careful action.

lines.text: To develop the fool, discipline is necessary. But excessive harshness brings regret.
lines.original: 初六：发蒙，利用刑人，用说桎梏。以往吝。

lines.text: Bear with the foolish kindly. Taking on responsibility for family brings good fortune.
lines.original: 九二：包蒙，吉。纳妇，吉。子克家。

lines.text: Do not marry a girl who loses herself when she sees wealth. Nothing is favorable.
lines.original: 六三：勿用取女，见金夫，不有躬。无攸利。

lines.text: Trapped in folly and isolation. This brings humiliation.
lines.original: 六四：困蒙，吝。

lines.text: Childlike innocence brings good fortune when it is sincere and open to learning.
lines.original: 六五：童蒙，吉。

lines.text: Strike the foolish one. It is not helpful to commit crimes, but it is right to prevent them.
lines.original: 上九：击蒙，不利为寇，利御寇。

hexagrams.name: Xū
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Waiting and nourishment; patience before the moment of action.
hexagrams.judgement: With sincerity and patience, light emerges. Good fortune comes to those who cross great waters at the right time.
hexagrams.imageText: Clouds rise in the sky, promising rain. The wise enjoy rest and feasting while waiting.

lines.text: Waiting in the meadow. It is favorable to remain constant and without error.
lines.original: 初九：需于郊，利用恒，无咎。

lines.text: Waiting on the sand. Small gossip arises, but the ending is good.
lines.original: 九二：需于沙，小有言，终吉。

lines.text: Waiting in the mud invites danger. Act with caution and awareness.
lines.original: 九三：需于泥，致寇至。

lines.text: Waiting in blood. Get out of the pit and accept what comes.
lines.original: 六四：需于血，出自穴。

lines.text: Waiting at the feast. Persistence brings good fortune.
lines.original: 九五：需于酒食，贞吉。

lines.text: Falling into the pit. Unexpected guests arrive; treat them with respect and all will be well.
lines.original: 上六：入于穴，有不速之客三人来，敬之终吉。

hexagrams.name: Sòng
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Conflict and contention requiring careful resolution.
hexagrams.judgement: You are sincere but obstructed. Careful deliberation brings good fortune. Going to the end brings misfortune.
hexagrams.imageText: Heaven and water move in opposite directions. The wise consider the beginning when planning actions.

lines.text: Do not perpetuate the conflict. Small talk may arise, but the ending will be fortunate.
lines.original: 初六：不永所事，小有言，终吉。

lines.text: You cannot win the lawsuit. Return home quickly and quietly; thus your people will be without fault.
lines.original: 九二：不克讼，归而逋。其邑人三百户，无眚。

lines.text: Feed on the ancient virtue. Danger, but the end is fortunate. Serving a king brings no accomplishment.
lines.original: 六三：食旧德。贞厉，终吉。或从王事，无成。

lines.text: You cannot win. Return and accept fate; changing course brings peace and good fortune.
lines.original: 九四：不克讼，复即命，渝安贞，吉。

lines.text: Contend before a judge. Great good fortune follows fair arbitration.
lines.original: 九五：讼，元吉。

lines.text: You may win and receive honors, but they will be taken away three times before morning.
lines.original: 上九：或锡之鞶带，终朝三褫之。

hexagrams.name: Shī
hexagrams.descriptionShort: The army; discipline, leadership, and collective effort.
hexagrams.judgement: With the right leader and proper cause, there is no blame. Discipline and experience are essential.
hexagrams.imageText: Water collects within the earth. The wise increases their numbers and welcomes the people generously.

lines.text: The army must set out in proper order. If discipline fails, misfortune follows.
lines.original: 初六：师出以律，否臧凶。

lines.text: In the center of the army brings good fortune and no blame. The king bestows honors three times.
lines.original: 九二：在师中吉，无咎。王三锡命。

lines.text: The army carries corpses in the wagon. Misfortune from lack of unity.
lines.original: 六三：师或舆尸，凶。

lines.text: The army retreats. No blame in knowing when to withdraw.
lines.original: 六四：师左次，无咎。

lines.text: Game is in the field. Speak firmly and without error. The eldest son leads; lesser men carry corpses.
lines.original: 六五：田有禽，利执言，无咎。长子帅师，弟子舆尸，贞凶。

lines.text: The great leader receives the mandate. Establishing order brings success; small men should not be employed.
lines.original: 上六：大君有命，开国承家。小人勿用。

hexagrams.name: Bǐ
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Holding together, alliance, and seeking unity.
hexagrams.judgement: Good fortune through unity. Ask the oracle again: do you have constancy and sincerity? Late arrivals meet misfortune.
hexagrams.imageText: Water rests on the earth. Ancient kings established nations and maintained relations with princes.

lines.text: Hold to unity with sincerity. No blame. Trust overflows like a full vessel; unexpected good comes.
lines.original: 初六：有孚比之，无咎。有孚盈缶，终来有他吉。

lines.text: Hold together from within. Persistence brings good fortune.
lines.original: 六二：比之自内，贞吉。

lines.text: You hold together with the wrong people. Misfortune follows poor alliances.
lines.original: 六三：比之匪人。

lines.text: Hold together with others outwardly. Persistence in goodness brings good fortune.
lines.original: 六四：外比之，贞吉。

lines.text: Manifest unity. The king uses beaters on three sides only, letting game escape in one direction. Citizens need no warning; good fortune.
lines.original: 九五：显比。王用三驱，失前禽。邑人不诫，吉。

lines.text: No head for holding together. Misfortune awaits those who lack leadership or direction.
lines.original: 上六：比之无首，凶。

hexagrams.name: Xiǎo Chù
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Small taming; gentle restraint and accumulation.
hexagrams.judgement: Success through gentle influence. Dense clouds but no rain from the western region.
hexagrams.imageText: Wind moves across heaven. The wise refines outward manner and displays inner virtue.

lines.text: Return to the way. How could this be wrong? Good fortune follows.
lines.original: 初九：复自道，何其咎？吉。

lines.text: Led back to the way. Good fortune through gentle guidance.
lines.original: 九二：牵复，吉。

lines.text: The wagon loses its wheel. Husband and wife turn their eyes away from each other.
lines.original: 九三：舆说辐，夫妻反目。

lines.text: With sincerity, fear and bloodshed vanish. No blame when integrity is present.
lines.original: 六四：有孚，血去惕出，无咎。

lines.text: Sincere and united with others. Wealth shared with neighbors creates bonds.
lines.original: 九五：有孚挛如，富以其邻。

lines.text: Rain has come; now rest. Virtue accumulates. For a woman, persistence is dangerous. The moon is nearly full; misfortune if the wise continues.
lines.original: 上九：既雨既处。尚德载。妇贞厉。月几望，君子征凶。

hexagrams.name: Lǚ
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Treading carefully; conduct and proper behavior.
hexagrams.judgement: Treading on the tiger's tail without being bitten. Success through care and respect.
hexagrams.imageText: Heaven above, lake below. The wise distinguishes high and low, establishing the people's aspirations.

lines.text: Simple conduct. Moving forward alone brings no blame when done sincerely.
lines.original: 初九：素履，往无咎。

lines.text: Treading a smooth, level path. The perseverance of a solitary person brings good fortune.
lines.original: 九二：履道坦坦，幽人贞吉。

lines.text: The one-eyed can still see; the lame can still walk. Treading on the tiger's tail gets bitten. A soldier acts for a great leader.
lines.original: 六三：眇能视，跛能履。履虎尾，咥人，凶。武人为于大君。

lines.text: Treading on the tiger's tail with caution. Success comes from awareness of danger.
lines.original: 九四：履虎尾，愬愬终吉。

lines.text: Resolute conduct. Persistence in the face of danger requires awareness.
lines.original: 九五：夬履，贞厉。

lines.text: Look back at your conduct and examine its signs. Complete good fortune arrives when all is in order.
lines.original: 上九：视履考祥，其旋元吉。

hexagrams.name: Tài
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Peace and prosperity; heaven and earth in harmony.
hexagrams.judgement: The small departs, the great approaches. Good fortune and success through proper timing.
hexagrams.imageText: Heaven and earth unite. The ruler divides and completes the way of heaven and earth, supporting the people.

lines.text: Pulling up ribbon grass brings others along. Undertakings bring good fortune.
lines.original: 初九：拔茅茹，以其汇。征吉。

lines.text: Bear with the uncultured gently. Cross the river with courage. Care for distant relations.
lines.original: 九二：包荒，用冯河，不遐遗。朋亡，得尚于中行。

lines.text: No plain not followed by slope. No going not followed by return. Remain steadfast amid difficulty.
lines.original: 九三：无平不陂，无往不复。艰贞无咎。勿恤其孚，于食有福。

lines.text: Flutter down without boasting of wealth. Join with neighbors in sincerity.
lines.original: 六四：翩翩，不富以其邻，不戒以孚。

lines.text: The sovereign gives his daughter in marriage. This brings blessing and great good fortune.
lines.original: 六五：帝乙归妹，以祉元吉。

lines.text: The wall falls back into the moat. Use no army; proclaim orders within your own town.
lines.original: 上六：城复于隍，勿用师。自邑告命，贞吝。

hexagrams.name: Pǐ
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Standstill and stagnation; heaven and earth not communicating.
hexagrams.judgement: Standstill caused by wrong people. The wise person's persistence does not further things now.
hexagrams.imageText: Heaven and earth do not unite. The wise withdraws into inner worth and avoids honors and income.

lines.text: Pulling up ribbon grass brings others along. Persistence brings good fortune and success.
lines.original: 初六：拔茅茹，以其汇。贞吉亨。

lines.text: Endure and obey. This brings good fortune to small people; stagnation turns to success for the great.
lines.original: 六二：包承，小人吉，大人否亨。

lines.text: They bear shame who do not act according to their position.
lines.original: 六三：包羞。

lines.text: Acting by command of heaven brings no blame. Companions share in the blessing.
lines.original: 九四：有命无咎，畴离祉。

lines.text: Standstill ends. Good fortune for the great. What if it fails? Bind it to mulberry shoots.
lines.original: 九五：休否，大人吉。其亡其亡，系于苞桑。

lines.text: Standstill overturned. First standstill, then joy.
lines.original: 上九：倾否，先否后喜。

hexagrams.name: Tóng Rén
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Fellowship with others; community and shared purpose.
hexagrams.judgement: Fellowship in the open brings success. It furthers one to cross the great water. The perseverance of a noble person brings fortune.
hexagrams.imageText: Heaven together with fire. The wise organizes clans and distinguishes things according to kinds.

lines.text: Fellowship at the gate. No blame in gathering with sincerity.
lines.original: 初九：同人于门，无咎。

lines.text: Fellowship within the clan. This brings humiliation through narrow focus.
lines.original: 六二：同人于宗，吝。

lines.text: Hiding weapons in the thicket, climbing the high hill. For three years, one does not rise.
lines.original: 九三：伏戎于莽，升其高陵，三岁不兴。

lines.text: Mounting the wall, yet unable to attack. Good fortune in recognizing limits.
lines.original: 九四：乘其墉，弗克攻，吉。

lines.text: Fellowship first weeps and laments, then laughs. Great hosts can unite and meet.
lines.original: 九五：同人，先号咷而后笑。大师克相遇。

lines.text: Fellowship in the meadow. No regret, though full success is not achieved.
lines.original: 上九：同人于郊，无悔。

hexagrams.name: Dà Yǒu
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Great possession and abundance through virtue.
hexagrams.judgement: Supreme success through clarity and strength combined.
hexagrams.imageText: Fire above heaven. The wise checks evil and furthers good, obeying the will of heaven.

lines.text: No relationship with what is harmful. No blame. Remaining aware of difficulty keeps one free of error.
lines.original: 初九：无交害，匪咎。艰则无咎。

lines.text: A great wagon for loading. One may undertake something; no blame.
lines.original: 九二：大车以载，有攸往，无咎。

lines.text: A prince offers it to the Son of Heaven. Small people cannot do this.
lines.original: 九三：公用亨于天子，小人弗克。

lines.text: Not his abundance. No blame when one knows their proper place.
lines.original: 九四：匪其彭，无咎。

lines.text: Sincere confidence creates mutual trust. Dignity brings good fortune.
lines.original: 六五：厥孚交如，威如，吉。

lines.text: From heaven, assistance. Good fortune. Nothing that does not further.
lines.original: 上九：自天佑之，吉，无不利。

hexagrams.name: Qiān
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Modesty and humility; the virtue that levels mountains.
hexagrams.judgement: Modesty creates success. The wise may carry things through.
hexagrams.imageText: Mountain within the earth. The wise reduces what is too much and augments what is too little, weighing things and making them equal.

lines.text: A modest person may cross the great water. Good fortune.
lines.original: 初六：谦谦君子，用涉大川，吉。

lines.text: Modesty that comes to expression. Persistence brings good fortune.
lines.original: 六二：鸣谦，贞吉。

lines.text: A modest person of merit carries things to conclusion. Good fortune.
lines.original: 九三：劳谦，君子有终，吉。

lines.text: Nothing that would not further. Modesty in movement.
lines.original: 六四：无不利，撝谦。

lines.text: Not wealthy through neighbors. It furthers one to attack with force. Nothing that would not further.
lines.original: 六五：不富以其邻，利用侵伐，无不利。

lines.text: Modesty that comes to expression. It furthers one to set armies marching to chastise one's own city.
lines.original: 上六：鸣谦，利用行师征邑国。

hexagrams.name: Yù
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Enthusiasm and harmony; providing for joy.
hexagrams.judgement: It furthers one to install helpers and to set armies marching.
hexagrams.imageText: Thunder comes resounding out of the earth. Ancient kings made music to honor merit and offered it with splendor to the Supreme Deity.

lines.text: Enthusiasm that expresses itself brings misfortune.
lines.original: 初六：鸣豫，凶。

lines.text: Firm as a rock. Not a whole day. Persistence brings good fortune.
lines.original: 六二：介于石，不终日，贞吉。

lines.text: Looking upward creates enthusiasm. Hesitation brings regret.
lines.original: 六三：盱豫，悔。迟有悔。

lines.text: The source of enthusiasm. Great success. Do not doubt. Friends gather around you like a clasp.
lines.original: 九四：由豫，大有得，勿疑。朋盍簪。

lines.text: Persistently ill, yet does not die.
lines.original: 六五：贞疾，恒不死。

lines.text: Deluded enthusiasm. But if after completion one changes, there is no blame.
lines.original: 上六：冥豫，成有渝，无咎。

hexagrams.name: Suí
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Following and adaptation; finding the right path.
hexagrams.judgement: Supreme success. Perseverance furthers. No blame.
hexagrams.imageText: Thunder in the lake. The wise at evening goes inside for rest and recuperation.

lines.text: The standard is changing. Persistence brings good fortune. Going out the door in company brings achievement.
lines.original: 初九：官有渝，贞吉，出门交有功。

lines.text: If one clings to the little boy, one loses the strong man.
lines.original: 六二：系小子，失丈夫。

lines.text: If one clings to the strong man, one loses the little boy. Through following, one finds what one seeks. It furthers one to remain persevering.
lines.original: 六三：系丈夫，失小子。随有求得，利居贞。

lines.text: Following creates success. Persistence brings misfortune. Sincere clarity on one's path brings understanding.
lines.original: 九四：随有获，贞凶。有孚在道，以明，何咎？

lines.text: Sincere in the good. Good fortune.
lines.original: 九五：孚于嘉，吉。

lines.text: Firmly bound, then tied. The king offers sacrifice on the Western Mountain.
lines.original: 上六：拘系之，乃从维之。王用亨于西山。

hexagrams.name: Gǔ
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Work on what has been spoiled; decay and renewal.
hexagrams.judgement: Supreme success. It furthers one to cross the great water. Before the starting point, three days. After the starting point, three days.
hexagrams.imageText: Wind at the foot of the mountain. The wise stirs up the people and strengthens their spirit.

lines.text: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. If there is a son, no blame rests upon the departed father. Danger. In the end, good fortune.
lines.original: 初六：干父之蛊，有子，考无咎。厉，终吉。

lines.text: Setting right what has been spoiled by the mother. One must not be too persevering.
lines.original: 九二：干母之蛊，不可贞。

lines.text: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. There will be some small regret, but no great blame.
lines.original: 九三：干父之蛊，小有悔，无大咎。

lines.text: Tolerating what has been spoiled by the father. In continuing one sees humiliation.
lines.original: 六四：裕父之蛊，往见吝。

lines.text: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. One meets with praise.
lines.original: 六五：干父之蛊，用誉。

lines.text: Not serving kings and princes; setting oneself higher goals.
lines.original: 上九：不事王侯，高尚其事。

hexagrams.name: Lín
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Approach and leadership; drawing near.
hexagrams.judgement: Supreme success. Perseverance furthers. When the eighth month comes, there will be misfortune.
hexagrams.imageText: Lake within the earth. The wise is inexhaustible in teaching and boundless in tolerance and protection of the people.

lines.text: Joint approach. Persistence brings good fortune.
lines.original: 初九：咸临，贞吉。

lines.text: Joint approach. Good fortune. Everything furthers.
lines.original: 九二：咸临，吉，无不利。

lines.text: Comfortable approach. Nothing that would further. If one is induced to grieve over it, one becomes free of blame.
lines.original: 六三：甘临，无攸利。既忧之，无咎。

lines.text: Complete approach. No blame.
lines.original: 六四：至临，无咎。

lines.text: Wise approach. This is right for a great leader. Good fortune.
lines.original: 六五：知临，大君之宜，吉。

lines.text: Great-hearted approach. Good fortune. No blame.
lines.original: 上六：敦临，吉，无咎。

hexagrams.name: Guān
hexagrams.descriptionShort: Contemplation and observation; looking down with clarity.
hexagrams.judgement: The ablution has been made, but not yet the offering. Full of trust they look up to him.
hexagrams.imageText: Wind moves over the earth. The ancient kings visited regions, observed the people, and provided instruction.

lines.text: Boylike contemplation. For an inferior person, no blame. For a wise person, humiliation.
lines.original: 初六：童观，小人无咎，君子吝。

lines.text: Contemplation through the crack of the door. Furthering for the perseverance of a woman.
lines.original: 六二：闚观，利女贞。

lines.text: Contemplation of one's own life decides the choice between advance and retreat.
lines.original: 六三：观我生，进退。

lines.text: Contemplation of the light of the kingdom. It furthers one to act as a guest of the king.
lines.original: 六四：观国之光，利用宾于王。

lines.text: Contemplation of one's own life. The wise person is without blame.
lines.original: 九五：观我生，君子无咎。

lines.text: Contemplation of their life. The wise person is without blame.
lines.original: 上九：观其生，君子无咎。
